'''Hidden innovation''' or '''invisible innovation''' refers to [[innovation]] that is not captured or recognised by traditional indicators such as [[research and development]] (R&D) spending or number of [[patent]]s. The term generally refers to innovation that takes place outside science & technology sectors, which are the primary sectors which invest in formal R&D and patents. For example, although technological innovations are often developed in the oil & gas sector through oil exploration activities, these innovations are unaccounted for in innovation metrics because oil exploration is not counted as formal R&D. Other types of innovation, including [[social innovation]], can be classed as hidden innovation.
'''Hidden innovation''' or '''invisible innovation''' refers to [[innovation]] that is not captured or recognised by traditional indicators such as [[research and development]] (R&D) spending or number of [[patent]]s. The term generally refers to innovation that takes place outside science & technology sectors, which are the primary sectors which invest in formal R&D and patents. For example, although technological innovations are often developed in the oil & gas sector through oil exploration activities, these innovations are unaccounted for in innovation metrics because oil exploration is not counted as formal R&D. Other types of innovation, including [[social innovation]], can be classed as hidden innovation.

==Career==

David qualified for the [[2014 BDO World Darts Championship]] as a qualifier, facing [[Julie Gore]] in the last 16, she lost 2–0. She qualified for the [[2018 BDO World Darts Championship]] as one of the Playoff Qualifiers, facing [[Deta Hedman]] in the last 16, she lost 2–0.
David qualified for the [[2014 BDO World Darts Championship]] as a qualifier, facing [[Julie Gore]] in the last 16, she lost 2–0. She qualified for the [[2018 BDO World Darts Championship]] as one of the Playoff Qualifiers, facing [[Deta Hedman]] in the last 16, she lost 2–0.

David has played in two platinum event finals in the [[World Darts Federation]] having reached the final of the 2025 [[World Masters (darts)|World Masters]] where she lost to [[Lorraine Hyde]] 6–5 and in the 2026 [[Dutch Open (darts)|Dutch Open]] where she lost to [[Priscilla Steenbergen]] in the final 5–3.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://dartswdf.com/competitions/dutch-open-women/2026/results|title=Dutch Open Women's results|date=8 February 2026|website=dartswdf.com|publisher=World Darts Federation|access-date= }}</ref>

← Previous revision Revision as of 19:48, 8 February 2026
Line 38: Line 38:
==Mac OS on Amiga==
==Mac OS on Amiga==
[[File:MacEmus.svg|thumb|History]]
[[File:MacEmus.svg|thumb|History]]
Also introduced for the Amiga were two products, [[A-Max]] (both internal and external models) and the Emplant expansion card. Both allowed the Amiga to emulate an Apple Macintosh and run the [[classic Mac OS]]. It required an Apple Macintosh ROM image, or actual ROMs in the case of A-Max, which needed to be obtained from a real Macintosh. The user needed to own the real Macintosh or Mac ROMs to legally run the emulator.
Also introduced for the Amiga were two products, A-Max (both internal and external models) and the Emplant expansion card. Both allowed the Amiga to emulate an Apple Macintosh and run the [[classic Mac OS]]. It required an Apple Macintosh ROM image, or actual ROMs in the case of A-Max, which needed to be obtained from a real Macintosh. The user needed to own the real Macintosh or Mac ROMs to legally run the emulator.


In 1988 the first Apple Mac emulator, A-Max, was released as an external device for any Amiga. It needed Mac ROMs to function, and could read Mac [[floppy disk|disk]]s when used with a Mac floppy drive (Amiga floppy drives are unable to read Mac disks. Unlike Amiga disks Mac floppy disks spin at variable speeds, much like [[CD-ROM]] drives). It wasn't a particularly elegant solution, but it did provide an affordable and usable Mac experience.
In 1988 the first Apple Mac emulator, A-Max, was released as an external device for any Amiga. It needed Mac ROMs to function, and could read Mac [[Floppy disk|disk]]s when used with a Mac floppy drive (Amiga floppy drives are unable to read Mac disks, and unlike Amiga disks Mac floppy disks spin at variable speeds, much like [[CD-ROM]] drives). It wasn't a particularly elegant solution, but it did provide an affordable and usable Mac experience.


ReadySoft, makers of A-Max, followed up with A-Max II in the early 1990s. A-Max II was contained on a Zorro-compatible card and allowed the user, again using actual Mac ROMs, to emulate a color Macintosh. In fact, an [[Amiga 3000]] emulating a Mac via A-Max II was significantly faster than the first consumer color Mac, the LC.
ReadySoft, makers of A-Max, followed up with A-Max II in the early 1990s. A-Max II was contained on a Zorro-compatible card and allowed the user, again using actual Mac ROMs, to emulate a color Macintosh. In fact, an [[Amiga 3000]] emulating a Mac via A-Max II was significantly faster than the first consumer color Mac, the LC.


Over time full-software virtualization was available, but a ROM image was still necessary. Example virtualization software include [[ShapeShifter (emulator)|ShapeShifter]] (not to be confused with the third party preference pane [[ShapeShifter]]), later superseded by [[Basilisk II]] (both by the same programmer who conceived [[SheepShaver]], [[Christian Bauer (programmer)|Christian Bauer]]), Fusion and iFusion (the latter ran classic Mac OS by using a [[PowerPC]] "coprocessor" accelerator card).
Over the time full-software virtualization was available, but a ROM image was still necessary. Example virtualization software include ShapeShifter (not to be confused with the third party preference pane [[Unsanity|ShapeShifter]]), later superseded by [[Basilisk II]] (both by the same programmer who conceived [[SheepShaver]], Christian Bauer), Fusion and iFusion (the latter ran classic Mac OS by using a [[PowerPC]] "coprocessor" accelerator card).


[[Virtual machine]]s provide equal or faster speed than a Macintosh with the same processor, especially with respect to the m68k series due to real Macs running in [[Memory management unit|MMU]] trap mode, hampering performance. Also, immediately after the 68k to PowerPC transition in 1994, there was a dearth of native PowerPC Mac software: Amiga computers with [[Motorola 68060|68060]] CPUs running ShapeShifter or Fusion were able to run 68k Macintosh code faster than real Macs.
[[Virtual machine]]s provide equal or faster speed than a Macintosh with the same processor, especially with respect to the m68k series due to real Macs running in [[Memory management unit|MMU]] trap mode, hampering performance. Also, immediately after the 68k to PowerPC transition in 1994, there was a dearth of native PowerPC Mac software: Amiga computers with [[Motorola 68060|68060]] CPUs running ShapeShifter or Fusion were able to run 68k Macintosh code faster than real Macs.
Line 50: Line 50:
Although Amigas were very successful at emulating Macintoshes, it was never considered to be a [[Macintosh clone]] as it could not use Mac OS as a primary operating system.
Although Amigas were very successful at emulating Macintoshes, it was never considered to be a [[Macintosh clone]] as it could not use Mac OS as a primary operating system.


Modern Amigas like [[AmigaOne]] and [[Genesi Pegasos|Pegasos]] can emulate Macintosh machines by using [[Basilisk II]] or Mac-on-Linux.
Modern Amigas like [[AmigaOne]] and [[Genesi Pegasos|Pegasos]] can emulate Macintosh machines by using Basilisk II or Mac-on-Linux.

'''John Chris Kiriakou''' ({{IPAc-en|k|i|r|i|'|A:|k|u:}} {{respell|kee|ree|AH|koo}};<ref>{{Cite AV media |title=CIA Officer Rates 9 Counterterrorism Scenes In Movies |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XXrxAMIULBo&t=15s |language=en |publisher=[[Insider Inc.|Insider]] |orig-date=Dec 17, 2024 |series=How Real Is It? |time=15 seconds |via=YouTube}}</ref> born August 9, 1964) is an American convicted felon, [[Whistleblowing|whistleblower]], author, journalist and former intelligence officer.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Coll |first=Steve |date=2013-03-25 |title=The Spy Who Said Too Much |url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2013/04/01/the-spy-who-said-too-much |access-date=2025-04-09 |magazine=The New Yorker |language=en-US |issn=0028-792X}}</ref> Kiriakou is a [[columnist]] with Reader Supported News.<ref name="Lester">{{cite magazine|last=Lester|first=Caroline|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/148342/cia-spy-became-russian-propagandist|title=The CIA Spy Who Became a Russian Propagandist|magazine=The New Republic|date=May 14, 2018|access-date=May 21, 2019}}</ref> He was sent to prison for exposing the interrogation techniques of the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] (CIA).

ce

← Previous revision Revision as of 19:48, 8 February 2026
Line 17: Line 17:
Most of the decisions reached about the recommended standard forms for each word were reached based in part on statistical analysis of the usage of the variant written forms in the ''[[People's Daily]]'' during the period 1995{{endash}}2000. Dictionaries consulted in the decision-making process included ''[[Xiandai Hanyu Cidian]]'', ''[[Hanyu Da Cidian]]'', ''[[Cihai]]'', ''[[Xinhua Cidian]]'' and ''[[Xiandai Hanyu Guifan Cidian]]''.<ref name="yixingci"/>{{rp|3}} Based on the evaluation of the committee, a decision was made concerning which form would be recommended to be considered as the standard form and which form(s) would be labelled as a variant form. A book was published detailing the rationales behind the decisions of the committee.<ref name="shuoming">{{cite book|editor1=异形词研究课题组|script-title=zh:第一批异形词整理表说明|date=January 2002|publisher=语文出版社 [Languages Press] |location=Beijing}}</ref>
Most of the decisions reached about the recommended standard forms for each word were reached based in part on statistical analysis of the usage of the variant written forms in the ''[[People's Daily]]'' during the period 1995{{endash}}2000. Dictionaries consulted in the decision-making process included ''[[Xiandai Hanyu Cidian]]'', ''[[Hanyu Da Cidian]]'', ''[[Cihai]]'', ''[[Xinhua Cidian]]'' and ''[[Xiandai Hanyu Guifan Cidian]]''.<ref name="yixingci"/>{{rp|3}} Based on the evaluation of the committee, a decision was made concerning which form would be recommended to be considered as the standard form and which form(s) would be labelled as a variant form. A book was published detailing the rationales behind the decisions of the committee.<ref name="shuoming">{{cite book|editor1=异形词研究课题组|script-title=zh:第一批异形词整理表说明|date=January 2002|publisher=语文出版社 [Languages Press] |location=Beijing}}</ref>


For example, the Chinese word written and pronounced as ''{{linktext|bǐngchéng|}}'' in Mandarin [[Pinyin]] (meaning: to receive an order) can be written as either (1) {{linktext|lang=zh-hans|秉承}} or (2) {{linktext|lang=zh-hans|稟承}} / {{linktext|lang=zh-hans|禀承}}<ref name="yixingci"/>{{rp|4}}<ref>{{cite book|script-title=zh:现代汉语词典(第七版). |trans-title=[[Xiandai Hanyu Cidian|A Dictionary of Current Chinese (Seventh Edition)]]. |date=1 September 2016|publisher=[[The Commercial Press]].|isbn=978-7-100-12450-8|page=94|location=Beijing |quote={{lang|zh-hans|【秉承】（禀承）}} {{Transliteration|zh|bǐngchéng}}}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dict.revised.moe.edu.tw/cgi-bin/cbdic/gsweb.cgi?o=dcbdic&searchid=Z00000019687|script-title=zh:教育部重編國語辭典修訂本 |publisher=[[Ministry of Education of the Republic of China]] |language=zh-hant}}</ref> (where both alternatives are as written as ''bǐngchéng'' and have the same meaning). In ''The First Series of Standardized Forms of Words with Non-standardized Variant Forms'', the first form ({{lang|zh-hans|秉承}}) was recommended to be the standard form, and the second form ({{lang|zh-hans|禀承}}) was designated as a variant form. The committee chose the first form ({{lang|zh-hans|秉承}}) as the recommended standard form because ''Xiandai Hanyu Cidian'' and ''Xinhua Cidian'' recommended the first form ({{lang|zh-hans|秉承}}) and because this form had been used 104 times in the ''People's Daily'' between 1995 and 2000. This decision was reached despite the fact that the second form ({{lang|zh-hans|禀承}}) was recommended by ''Cihai'' and the committee explicitly stated that the second form was probably the more linguistically appropriate alternative based on analysis of the usage and definition of the relevant characters as found in ''[[Shuowen]]'', ''[[Guangya]]'', and ''[[Zuozhuan]]''. The second form ({{lang|zh-hans|禀承}}) was determined to have fallen out of popular usage in a modern context- it had been used only three times in the ''People's Daily'' between 1995 and 2000.<ref name="shuoming"/>{{rp|28}}
For example, the Chinese word written and pronounced as ''{{linktext|bǐngchéng|}}'' in Mandarin [[Pinyin]] (meaning: to receive an order) can be written as either (1) {{linktext|lang=zh-hans|秉承}} or (2) {{linktext|lang=zh-hans|稟承}} / {{linktext|lang=zh-hans|禀承}}<ref name="yixingci"/>{{rp|4}}<ref>{{cite book|script-title=zh:现代汉语词典(第七版). |trans-title=[[Xiandai Hanyu Cidian|A Dictionary of Current Chinese (Seventh Edition)]]. |date=1 September 2016|publisher=[[The Commercial Press]].|isbn=978-7-100-12450-8|page=94|location=Beijing |quote={{lang|zh-hans|【秉承】（禀承）}} {{Transliteration|zh|bǐngchéng}}}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dict.revised.moe.edu.tw/cgi-bin/cbdic/gsweb.cgi?o=dcbdic&searchid=Z00000019687|script-title=zh:教育部重編國語辭典修訂本 |publisher=[[Ministry of Education of the Republic of China]] |language=zh-hant}}</ref> (where both are pronounced ''bǐngchéng'' and have the same meaning). In ''The First Series of Standardized Forms of Words with Non-standardized Variant Forms'', the first form ({{lang|zh-hans|秉承}}) was recommended to be the standard form, and the second form ({{lang|zh-hans|禀承}}) was designated as a variant form. The committee chose the first form ({{lang|zh-hans|秉承}}) as the recommended standard form because ''Xiandai Hanyu Cidian'' and ''Xinhua Cidian'' recommended the first form ({{lang|zh-hans|秉承}}) and because this form had been used 104 times in the ''People's Daily'' between 1995 and 2000. This decision was reached despite the fact that the second form ({{lang|zh-hans|禀承}}) was recommended by ''Cihai'' and the committee explicitly stated that the second form was probably the more linguistically appropriate alternative based on analysis of the usage and definition of the relevant characters as found in ''[[Shuowen]]'', ''[[Guangya]]'', and ''[[Zuozhuan]]''. The second form ({{lang|zh-hans|禀承}}) was determined to have fallen out of popular usage in a modern context- it had been used only three times in the ''People's Daily'' between 1995 and 2000.<ref name="shuoming"/>{{rp|28}}

← Previous revision Revision as of 19:48, 8 February 2026
Line 1: Line 1:
Since August 2025, barricades and protests in [[Dupax del Norte]] have blocked [[mining]] exploration activities by Woggle Corporation, a subsidiary of FCF Minerals Corporation and Metals Exploration plc. The protests, led by environmentalists and the [[Diocese of Bayombong|local Catholic diocese]], are held in the province of [[Nueva Vizcaya]], whose residents have long protested against the environmental impacts of mining. Nueva Vizcaya sits on numerous protected areas and watersheds, with the town of Dupax del Norte situated within the Dupax Watershed Forest Reserve. Woggle Corporation maintains that it secured the necessary requirements for its exploration permit issued by the [[Mines and Geosciences Bureau]] of the [[Department of Environment and Natural Resources]], though local officials and residents dispute this, saying that no proper consultations took place—a requirement for the issuance of its exploration permit. Protestors also allege Woggle of illegally executing its exploration activities by uprooting trees without the necessary permits and trespassing.
{{under construction}}

== Background ==
== Background ==
'''Metals Exploration plc''' (MTL)—through its subsidiary, '''FCF Minerals Corporation'''—currently operates a [[gold]] and [[molybdenum]] mine in [[Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya]]. FCF was incorporated in 2001, and later became a subsidiary for London-based Metals Exploration plc in September 2005.<ref>{{Cite web |title=FCF Minerals catapults Nueva Vizcaya town to first-class status |url=https://www.philstar.com/business/2025/03/02/2425121/fcf-minerals-catapults-nueva-vizcaya-town-first-class-status |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=Philstar.com}}</ref> Mining clearance for the '''Runruno Gold-Molybdenum Project''' was granted in 2011, following five years of exploration.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lagasca |first=Charlie |title=UK firm gets mining permit in N. Vizcaya |url=https://www.philstar.com/nation/2011/11/22/750265/uk-firm-gets-mining-permit-n-vizcaya |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=Philstar.com}}</ref> [[Typhoon Koppu]] in 2015 suspended construction works in the mine from October 2015 to April 2016.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Gonzalez |first=Mia |date=2016-10-07 |title=FCF Minerals Corp to start gold mine operation in Nueva Vizcaya this year |url=https://www.rappler.com/business/industries/148477-british-gold-mine-nueva-vizcaya/ |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=RAPPLER |language=en-US}}</ref> It began operations in 2017, expecting an output of {{Convert|96700|oz|kg}} of gold yearly over 10 years of operation.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web |last=Martin |first=Victor |title=New Nueva Vizcaya mining project set to start commercial operations |url=https://www.philstar.com/business/2017/07/08/1717647/new-nueva-vizcaya-mining-project-set-start-commercial-operations |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=Philstar.com}}</ref> [[Excise|Excise tax]] from the mine's operations have since brought Quezon from a [[Municipalities of the Philippines#Income classification|fourth-class municipality]] (a municipality earning {{Philippine peso|90–130}} million annually) to a first-class municipality (earning over {{Philippine peso|200}} million annually).<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |title=FCF Minerals catapults Nueva Vizcaya town to first-class status |url=https://www.philstar.com/business/2025/03/02/2425121/fcf-minerals-catapults-nueva-vizcaya-town-first-class-status |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=Philstar.com}}</ref> As of 2025, FCF had contributed {{Philippine peso|5.71}} billion in taxes, fees, and duties since operations started in 2017. It also operates a social development program which supports welfare and infrastructure programs in the area. Prior to the protests, Quezon mayor Dolores Binwag called the Runruno project instrumental for improvements in local infrastructure.<ref name=":1" />

Communities in Nueva Vizcaya have long protested mining due to its potential threats to agriculture and the ecosystem, starting with the [[Didipio mine]] (operated by [[OceanaGold]]) which began operations in 1994.<ref name=":10" /> Mining operations in Didipio and Runruno have been blamed for water depletion, environmental damage, and societal conflict.<ref name=":11">{{Cite web |last=Saludes |first=Mark |date=2026-01-26 |title=Arrests of anti-mining residents in Dupax del Norte draw condemnation |url=https://www.altermidya.net/arrests-of-anti-mining-residents-in-dupax-del-norte-draw-condemnation/ |access-date=2026-02-08 |website=Altermidya}}</ref><!-- TODO: This doesn't go deep into the long history of Nueva Vizcaya being an anti-mining province, so readers don't know that anti-mining protests happen very frequently. -->
Communities in Nueva Vizcaya have long protested mining due to its potential threats to agriculture and the ecosystem, starting with the [[Didipio mine]] (operated by [[OceanaGold]]) which began operations in 1994.<ref name=":10" /> Mining operations in Didipio and Runruno have been blamed for water depletion, environmental damage, and societal conflict.<ref name=":11">{{Cite web |last=Saludes |first=Mark |date=2026-01-26 |title=Arrests of anti-mining residents in Dupax del Norte draw condemnation |url=https://www.altermidya.net/arrests-of-anti-mining-residents-in-dupax-del-norte-draw-condemnation/ |access-date=2026-02-08 |website=Altermidya}}</ref>

== 2025 ==
== 2025 ==
As a requirement for its exploration permit, Woggle requested a Certificate of Consultation from the council of Oyao, a [[barangay]] in Dupax del Norte. The Oyao council, however, denied the request on August 25. Chairman Junior Taligan of the Oyao barangay council denied that a proper consultation was done, with a meeting done by Woggle on August 15, 2025 only being an "information and education campaign".<ref name=":3" /> Local officials and residents soon sent their complaints to the MGB, alleging violations of the Dupax del Norte mine's exploration permit, such as the uprooting of trees and trespassing.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web |last=Dumlao |first=Artemio |date=2025-09-02 |title=MGB-2 to look into alleged mining violations in Nueva Vizcaya |url=https://www.bworldonline.com/the-nation/2025/09/02/695411/mgb-2-to-look-into-alleged-mining-violations-in-nueva-vizcaya/ |access-date=2026-02-07 |website=BusinessWorld Online |language=en-US}}</ref> A resident also reported that Woggle had begun building a road up to a site in [[purok]] Keon in Bitnong.<ref name=":12" /> A pastoral letter by bishop [[Jose Elmer Mangalinao]] of the [[Diocese of Bayombong]] denounced the MGB's approval of Woggle's mining exploration permit. He also questions officials who backed the permit, urging for "transparency, accountability, and action from those in power."<ref name=":2" /> On August 18, the provincial board of Nueva Vizcaya adopted a resolution requesting the MGB to cancel the exploration permit of Woggle Corporation for violation of environmental and procedural requirements.<ref name=":6">{{Cite web |last=De Layola |first=Zaldy |date=2025-10-27 |title=Lawmaker seeks probe on alleged illegal mining in N. Vizcaya town |url=https://www.pna.gov.ph/index.php/articles/1261897 |access-date=2026-02-08 |website=Philippine News Agency}}</ref> Despite the mounting opposition, the [[Sangguniang Panlalawigan|provincial board]] of Nueva Vizcaya voted to issue a Certificate of Consultation to Woggle on August 20 following a briefing with the company, with only one objecting.<ref name=":12">{{Cite web |last=Molintas |first=Danilova |date=2025-08-23 |title=Residents, officials protest mining exploration in Nueva Vizcaya town |url=https://nordis.net/2025/08/23/article/news/residents-officials-protest-mining-exploration-in-nueva-vizcaya-town/ |access-date=2026-02-08 |website=Northern Dispatch}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Philippine Information Agency Nueva Vizcaya |date=2025-08-20 |title=LOOK: Officials of Woggle Corporation brief members of the Sangguniang Panlalawigan today on their current activities in Dupax del Norte. |url=https://www.facebook.com/piavizcaya/posts/pfbid02McFdGfSGD4kEeimgsqjHGsBGHWo3fTXLGJM3KRHKCSaZGZrhicwbPrkDuzYBNUZnl |access-date=2026-02-08 |website=Facebook}}</ref>

This followed a January 23 report from the NVPPO chief which detailed continued acts of obstruction and resistance from the protestors. The court also accused Daynos of sharing Facebook posts urging protestors to converge in the area in defiance of the injunction.<ref name=":16" /> In a privilege speech, Senator [[Erwin Tulfo]] called for a senate investigation into the exploration activities, the forceful dispersal of protestors on January 23, and the DENR-MGB's issuance of an exploration permit despite the lack of consultation from residents and local officials.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cabayan |first=Itchie |date=2026-02-04 |title=Senate Probe On Alleged LGU Bypass In Dupax Del Norte Mining Urged By Sen. On January 28, Attolba issued a new order ''motu propio'' directing the seven protestors to [[Order to show cause|show cause]] on why they should not be cited in contempt. This followed a January 23 report from the NVPPO chief which detailed continued acts of obstruction and resistance from the protestors. The court also accused Daynos of sharing Facebook posts urging protestors to converge in the area in defiance of the injunction.<ref name=":16" /> In a privilege speech, Senator [[Erwin Tulfo]] called for a senate investigation into the exploration activities, the forceful dispersal of protestors on January 23, and the DENR-MGB's issuance of an exploration permit despite the lack of consultation from residents and local officials.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cabayan |first=Itchie |date=2026-02-04 |title=Senate Probe On Alleged LGU Bypass In Dupax Del Norte Mining Urged By Sen. Erwin Tulfo As He Condemns Protesters' Violent Dispersal Of Protesters {{!}} Journal Online |url=https://journal.com.ph/senate-probe-on-alleged-lgu-bypass-in-dupax-del-norte-mining-urged-by-sen-erwin-tulfo-as-he-condemns-protesters-violent-dispersal-of-protesters/ |access-date=2026-02-08 |website=Journal Online |language=en-US}}</ref>{{Bsn|reason=The current source is insufficiently reliable ([[WP:NOTRS]]).|date=February 2026}}

On February 2, a local ordinance aimed at setting a [[Moratorium (law)|moratorium]] against mining for 50 years was rejected by the provincial board, citing it as beyond the authority of the province due to existing laws (namely the Philippine Mining Act).<ref>{{Cite web |last=Domingo |first=Leander |date=2026-02-02 |title=Nueva Vizcaya Board rejects Dupax mining moratorium as unconstitutional |url=https://www.manilatimes.net/2026/02/02/regions/nueva-vizcaya-board-rejects-dupax-mining-moratorium-as-unconstitutional/2269350 |access-date=2026-02-08 |website=The Manila Times |language=en}}</ref>

'''Hesarcheh Rural District''' ({{langx|fa|دهستان حصارچه}}) is in [[Jargalan District]] of [[Raz and Jargalan County]], [[North Khorasan province|North Khorasan]] province, [[Iran]]. Its capital is the village of [[Hesarcheh-ye Bala]].<ref name="Raz and Jargalan County Establishment">{{cite report|title=Distributional changes in North Khorasan province|language=fa|website=qavanin.ir|via=Laws and Regulations Portal of the Islamic Republic of Iran|url=https://qavanin.ir/Law/TreeText/197909|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210108123301/https://qavanin.ir/Law/TreeText/197909|publisher=Ministry of the Interior, Cabinet of Ministers|archive-date=8 January 2021|orig-date=Approved 29 September 2013|date=c. 2021|id=Proposal 185757/42/4/1|last=Rahimi|first=Mohammad Reza|access-date=19 May 2023}}</ref>
'''Hesarcheh Rural District''' ({{langx|fa|دهستان حصارچه}}) is in [[Jargalan District]] of [[Raz and Jargalan County]], [[North Khorasan province|North Khorasan]] province, [[Iran]]. Its capital is the village of [[Hesarcheh-ye Bala]].<ref name="Raz and Jargalan County Establishment"> {{cite web |first=Mohammad Reza |last=Rahimi |author-link=Mohammad Reza Rahimi |orig-date={{lang|fa|rtl=yes|مصوب}} (Approved) 1391,09,29 (Iranian Jalali calendar) |date=19 December 2012 <!-- Converted date using https://www.iranchamber.com/calendar/converter/iranian_calendar_converter.php --> |script-title=fa:تغييرات تقسيماتي در استان خراسان شمالي |trans-title=‌Divisional changes in North Khorasan province |url=https://qavanin.ir/Law/TreeText/197909 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210108123301/https://qavanin.ir/Law/TreeText/197909 |archive-date=8 January 2021 |access-date=1 February 2026 |website={{lang|fa|rtl=yes|سامانه ملی قوانین و مقررات}} [National System of Laws and Regulations] |publisher={{lang|fa|rtl=yes|‌وزارت کشور}} [Ministry of the Interior] |agency={{lang|fa|rtl=yes|هیات وزیران}} [Council of Ministers] |language=fa |id={{lang|fa|rtl=yes|پيشنهاد شماره}} [Proposal Number] 185757/42/1/4.}}</ref>


==History==
==History==
After the 2011 National Census, [[Raz and Jargalan District]] was separated from [[Bojnord County]] in the establishment of Raz and Jargalan County, and Hesarcheh Rural District was created in the new Jargalan District.<ref name="Raz and Jargalan County Establishment"/>
In 2012, [[Raz and Jargalan District]] was separated from [[Bojnord County]] in the establishment of [[Raz and Jargalan County]], and Hesarcheh Rural District was created in the new [[Jargalan District]].<ref name="Raz and Jargalan County Establishment"/>


==Demographics==
==Demographics==
===Population===
===Population===
At the time of the 2016 census, the rural district's population was 9,826 in 2,500 households. The most populous of its 15 villages was [[Bacheh Darreh]], with 1,776 people.<ref name="2016 North Khorasan Province">{{cite report|title=Census of the Islamic Republic of Iran, 1395 (2016): North Khorasan Province|language=fa|publisher=The Statistical Center of Iran|website=amar.org.ir|url=https://www.amar.org.ir/Portals/0/census/1395/results/abadi/CN95_HouseholdPopulationVillage_28.xlsx|access-date=19 December 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201027174651/https://www.amar.org.ir/Portals/0/census/1395/results/abadi/CN95_HouseholdPopulationVillage_28.xlsx|format=Excel|archive-date=27 October 2020}}</ref>
At the time of the 2016 National Census, the rural district's population was 9,826 in 2,500 households. The most populous of its 15 villages was [[Bacheh Darreh]], with 1,776 people.<ref name="2016 North Khorasan Province"> {{cite web |script-title=fa:سرشماري عمومي نفوس و مسكن 1395 : استان خراسان شمالی |trans-title=General Population and Housing Census 2016: North Khorasan Province |language=fa |website={{lang|fa|rtl=yes|مرکز آمار ایران}} [Statistical Centre of Iran] |url=https://www.amar.org.ir/Portals/0/census/1395/results/abadi/CN95_HouseholdPopulationVillage_28.xlsx |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201027174651/https://www.amar.org.ir/Portals/0/census/1395/results/abadi/CN95_HouseholdPopulationVillage_28.xlsx |archive-date=27 October 2020 |format=Excel |access-date=19 December 2022}}</ref>

'''''Sibylla Sambetha''''' ('''''the Persian [[Sibyl]]''''', also known simply as '''''Portrait of a Young Woman''''') is a small [[Panel painting|oil-on-oak]] painting by the German-[[Flemish people|Flemish]] painter [[Hans Memling]]. Although the inscriptions on the border of the brown marble frame state that it was completed in 1480, there is no record of the woman's identity. The panel has been in the collection of the [[Old St. John's Hospital]] in [[Bruges]] since 1815.<ref name="d86">Depoorter (2018), p. 86</ref>
'''''Sibylla Sambetha''''' ('''''the Persian [[Sibyl]]''''', also known simply as '''''Portrait of a Young Woman''''') is a small [[Panel painting|oil-on-oak]] painting by the German-[[Flemish people|Flemish]] painter [[Hans Memling]]. Although the inscriptions on the border of the brown marble frame state that it was completed in 1480, there is no record of the woman's identity.


The picture shows a young woman who is not pretty<ref name="m127">Michiels (2008), p. 127</ref> but elegant and well-dressed. Her wealth and status are indicated by her [[hennin]], chain and rings. She is set against a flat, black background and looks outwards, beyond the pictorial frame; avoiding the gaze of the viewer.<ref name="dbnl">"[http://www.dbnl.org/tekst/_low001199401_01/_low001199401_01_0014.php Hans Memling and His Art]". De Digitale Bibliotheek voor de Nederlandse Letteren. Retrieved 30 March 2014</ref> Her hands are folded while her fingertips rest on the lower border of a painted brown marbled frame, in an early and effective example of [[trompe-l'œil]], a device the art historian Matthias Depoorter described as allowing Memling to "merge the painted space with the real one".<ref name="d86" />
The picture shows a young woman who is not pretty<ref name="m127">Michiels (2008), p. 127</ref> but elegant and well-dressed. Her wealth and status are indicated by her [[hennin]], chain and rings. She is set against a flat, black background and looks outwards, beyond the pictorial frame; avoiding the gaze of the viewer.<ref name="dbnl">"[http://www.dbnl.org/tekst/_low001199401_01/_low001199401_01_0014.php Hans Memling and His Art]". De Digitale Bibliotheek voor de Nederlandse Letteren. Retrieved 30 March 2014</ref> Her hands are folded while her fingertips rest on the lower border of a painted brown marbled frame, in an early and effective example of [[trompe-l'œil]], a device the art historian Matthias Depoorter described as allowing Memling to "merge the painted space with the real one".<ref name="d86" />

The panel has been in the collection of the [[Old St. John's Hospital]] in [[Bruges]] since 1815.<ref name="d86">Depoorter (2018), p. 86</ref>


==Sitter's identity==
==Sitter's identity==
[[File:Andrea del Castagno 005.jpg|thumb|upright=0.6|''The Cumean Sibyl'', fresco by [[Andrea del Castagno]], c. 1450]]
[[File:Andrea del Castagno 005.jpg|thumb|upright=0.6|''The Cumean Sibyl'', fresco by [[Andrea del Castagno]], c. 1450]]
The word sibyl is [[Ancient Greek]] in origin (Σίβυλλα). In pre-Christian [[classical mythology]], [[Sibyl]]s were originally female [[oracles]] and advisors, who were later credited as predictors of the coming of Christ. The origional sibyl was called "the Sibylla", and eventualy their number grew to ten indivisual women.<ref>Reyniers (2002), p. 1</ref>
The word sibyl is [[Ancient Greek]] in origin (Σίβυλλα). In pre-Christian [[classical mythology]], [[Sibyl]]s were originally female [[oracles]] and advisors, who were later credited as predictors of the coming of Christ. The origional sibyl was called "the Sibylla", and eventually their number grew to ten individual women.<ref>Reyniers (2002), p. 1</ref>


The painted metal [[cartouche]] placed at the top left of the panel is a later addition. It contains the words "<small>SIBYLLA SAMBETHA QVAE ET PERSICA, AN: ANTE CHRIST: NAT: 2040</small>" (''The Sibyl Sambetha, the [[Persians|Persian]], in the year 2040 BC'').<ref>Eemans (1970), p. 24</ref><ref>Reyniers (2002), p. 3</ref>
The painted metal [[cartouche]] placed at the top left of the panel is a later addition. It contains the words "<small>SIBYLLA SAMBETHA QVAE ET PERSICA, AN: ANTE CHRIST: NAT: 2040</small>" (''The Sibyl Sambetha, the [[Persians|Persian]], in the year 2040 BC'').<ref>Eemans (1970), p. 24</ref><ref>Reyniers (2002), p. 3</ref>

== Context ==
== Context ==
Paradiplomacy may be performed both in support of and in complementarity to the central state conducted [[diplomacy]], or come in conflict or compete with it. In 1990, [[Ivo Duchacek]] pointed out a distinction between different types of paradiplomatic engagements: a) cross-border regional paradiplomacy, b) transregional paradiplomacy and c) global paradiplomacy, to describe: a) contacts between non-central units situated across borders in different states, b) contacts between non-central units without a common border but situated in neighboring states and c) contacts between units belonging to states without common borders. An additional type labelled d) "protodiplomacy" implies actions motivated by separatist/secessionnist objectives - also framed as "sovereignty paradiplomacy" in the more recent typology proposed by [[Rodrigo Tavares]].<ref>{{cite book |last1=Tavares |first1=Rodrigo |title=Paradiplomacy : cities and states as global players |date=2016 |location=New York |isbn=9780190462116}}</ref> A comprising view of the phenomenon should also consider formal and informal contacts in a wide range of multilateral associations of local authorities, and their growing presence in global summits and governance instances.
Paradiplomacy may be performed both in support of and in complementarity to the central state conducted [[diplomacy]], or come in conflict or compete with it. In 1990, [[Ivo Duchacek]] pointed out a distinction between different types of paradiplomatic engagements: a) cross-border regional paradiplomacy, b) transregional paradiplomacy and c) global paradiplomacy, to describe: a) contacts between non-central units situated across borders in different states, b) contacts between non-central units without a common border but situated in neighboring states and c) contacts between units belonging to states without common borders. An additional type labelled d) "[[protodiplomacy]]" implies actions motivated by separatist/secessionnist objectives - also framed as "sovereignty paradiplomacy" in the more recent typology proposed by [[Rodrigo Tavares]].<ref>{{cite book |last1=Tavares |first1=Rodrigo |title=Paradiplomacy : cities and states as global players |date=2016 |location=New York |isbn=9780190462116}}</ref> A comprising view of the phenomenon should also consider formal and informal contacts in a wide range of multilateral associations of local authorities, and their growing presence in global summits and governance instances.


Non-central governments may formally develop official international relations by: a) sending delegations in official visits; b) signing [[Treaty|agreements]], [[memoranda of understanding]] and other instruments; c) participating in international "local" fora; d) establishing permanent representative offices or delegations abroad.
Non-central governments may formally develop official international relations by: a) sending delegations in official visits; b) signing [[Treaty|agreements]], [[memoranda of understanding]] and other instruments; c) participating in international "local" fora; d) establishing permanent representative offices or delegations abroad.
Line 33: Line 33:
As to the political aspects, local governments may join efforts internationally to pressure their central governments into a desired course of action. This strategy is exemplified in the case of eight memoranda of understanding signed, in the years 1980, between three American states and three Canadian provinces to control and combat [[acid rain]], as the Reagan Administration and the American Congress could not reach a consensus on the matter. The cross-borders paradiplomatic efforts eventually led Washington to amend the [[Clean Air Act (United States)|Clean Air Act]] in 1990 and to sign with Canada, in 1991, the [[US/Canada Air Quality Agreement]] in which both countries agree on a timetable to reduce acid emissions.
As to the political aspects, local governments may join efforts internationally to pressure their central governments into a desired course of action. This strategy is exemplified in the case of eight memoranda of understanding signed, in the years 1980, between three American states and three Canadian provinces to control and combat [[acid rain]], as the Reagan Administration and the American Congress could not reach a consensus on the matter. The cross-borders paradiplomatic efforts eventually led Washington to amend the [[Clean Air Act (United States)|Clean Air Act]] in 1990 and to sign with Canada, in 1991, the [[US/Canada Air Quality Agreement]] in which both countries agree on a timetable to reduce acid emissions.


A particular kind of local political activism is called "protodiplomacy", through which a local government may seek international support for their emancipation or independence plans. This is typically the case of the Canadian province of [[Québec]] in the seventies, under the [[Parti Québécois]].
A particular kind of local political activism is called "[[protodiplomacy]]", through which a local government may seek international support for their emancipation or independence plans. This is typically the case of the Canadian province of [[Québec]] in the seventies, under the [[Parti Québécois]].


Non-central governments may be allowed to negotiate and sign agreements with foreign non-central authorities or even with the government of a foreign state. Conditions can vary largely from a limited capacity to negotiate with the assistance of their central authorities to a most complete autonomy based on sovereign constitutional prerogatives. This can not be the object of the international law. Only the internal law of the states is to determine which internal powers are entitled to do so and to which extent. In some states, the outward relations of their non-central governments is a constitutional matter directly related to the issue of legal competence.

Medieval Kabbalistic [[grimoire]]s show hexagrams among the tables of [[segulot]], but without identifying them as "Shield of David".
Medieval Kabbalistic [[grimoire]]s show hexagrams among the tables of [[segulot]], but without identifying them as "Shield of David".


In the Renaissance, in the 16th-century Land of Israel, the book [[Etz Chaim|Ets Khayim]] conveys the Kabbalah of Ha-Ari ([[Rabbi Isaac Luria]]) who arranges the traditional items on the seder plate for [[Passover]] into two triangles, where they explicitly correspond to Jewish mystical concepts. The six [[sephirot|sfirot]] of the masculine Zer Anpin correspond to the six items on the seder plate, while the seventh sfira being the feminine Malkhut corresponds to the plate itself.<ref>Rabbi Blumenkrantz, "[http://www.neveh.org/pesach/pesblm1.html The Seder", ''The Laws of Pesach: A Digest''] 2010: Chap. 9. See also: {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317082009/http://www.neveh.org/pesach/pesblm1.html|date=March 17, 2016}}, retrieved May 28, 2010.</ref><ref>{{cite web |author=Yirmiyahu Ullman |date=May 5, 2008 |title=Magen David |publisher=Ohr Samayach |url=https://ohr.edu/this_week/ask_the_rabbi/3457 |access-date=May 28, 2010}}</ref><ref>Simon Jacobson, op-ed, [http://www.meaningfullife.com/oped/2006/04.08.06$Tzav-PassoverCOLON_The_Seder_Plate.php "Tzav-Passover: The Seder Plate"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140810080938/http://meaningfullife.com/oped/2006/04.08.06$Tzav-PassoverCOLON_The_Seder_Plate.php |date=August 10, 2014 }}, ''A Meaningful Life'', retrieved May 28, 2010.</ref>
In the Renaissance, in the 16th-century Land of Israel, the book [[Etz Chaim|Ets Khayim]] conveys the Kabbalah of Ha-Ari ([[Rabbi Isaac Luria]]) who arranges the traditional items on the seder plate for [[Passover]] into two triangles, where they explicitly correspond to Jewish mystical concepts. The six [[sephirot|sfirot]] of the masculine [[Zeir Anpin|Zer Anpin]] correspond to the six items on the seder plate, while the seventh sfira being the feminine Malkhut corresponds to the plate itself.<ref>Rabbi Blumenkrantz, "[http://www.neveh.org/pesach/pesblm1.html The Seder", ''The Laws of Pesach: A Digest''] 2010: Chap. 9. See also: {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317082009/http://www.neveh.org/pesach/pesblm1.html|date=March 17, 2016}}, retrieved May 28, 2010.</ref><ref>{{cite web |author=Yirmiyahu Ullman |date=May 5, 2008 |title=Magen David |publisher=Ohr Samayach |url=https://ohr.edu/this_week/ask_the_rabbi/3457 |access-date=May 28, 2010}}</ref><ref>Simon Jacobson, op-ed, [http://www.meaningfullife.com/oped/2006/04.08.06$Tzav-PassoverCOLON_The_Seder_Plate.php "Tzav-Passover: The Seder Plate"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140810080938/http://meaningfullife.com/oped/2006/04.08.06$Tzav-PassoverCOLON_The_Seder_Plate.php |date=August 10, 2014 }}, ''A Meaningful Life'', retrieved May 28, 2010.</ref>


However, these seder-plate triangles are parallel, one above the other, and do not actually form a hexagram.<ref>Gershom Scholem shows conclusively they do not form a hexagram. See, ''Hatakh ha-Zahav, Hotam Shelomoh u-Magen-David'' (Poalim, Hebrew) 1990:156.</ref>

'''Kartikeyan Pandian''' (also known as '''V. Karthikeyan Pandian''', born 29 May 1974), is a retired [[Indian Administrative Service]] (IAS) officer of the 2000 batch from the Odisha cadre, known for his close association with [[Odisha]] Chief Minister [[Naveen Patnaik]]. Pandian has served in various key administrative roles in the state and played a significant part in shaping Odisha's governance and public service delivery mechanisms.
'''Kartikeya Pandian''' (also known as '''V. Karthikeya Pandian''', born 29 May 1974), is a retired [[Indian Administrative Service]] (IAS) officer of the 2000 batch from the Odisha cadre, known for his close association with [[Odisha]] Chief Minister [[Naveen Patnaik]]. Pandian has served in various key administrative roles in the state and played a significant part in shaping Odisha's governance and public service delivery mechanisms.


He held the post of Chairman 5T (Transformational Initiatives) with the rank of a [[Minister (government)|Cabinet Minister]] during [[Fifth Naveen Patnaik ministry]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Barik |first1=Satyasundar |date=24 October 2023 |title=Day after quitting IAS, Odisha Chief Minister's aide V.K. '''Hidden innovation''' or '''Invisible innovation''' refers to [[innovation]] that is not captured or recognised by traditional indicators such as [[research and development]] (R&D) spending or number of [[patent]]s. The term generally refers to innovation that takes place outside science & technology sectors, which are the primary sectors which invest in formal R&D and patents. For example, although technological innovations are often developed in the oil & gas sector through oil exploration activities, these innovations are unaccounted for in innovation metrics because oil exploration is not counted as formal R&D. Other types of innovation, including [[social innovation]], can be classed as hidden innovation.
'''Hidden innovation''' or '''invisible innovation''' refers to [[innovation]] that is not captured or recognised by traditional indicators such as [[research and development]] (R&D) spending or number of [[patent]]s. The term generally refers to innovation that takes place outside science & technology sectors, which are the primary sectors which invest in formal R&D and patents. For example, although technological innovations are often developed in the oil & gas sector through oil exploration activities, these innovations are unaccounted for in innovation metrics because oil exploration is not counted as formal R&D. Other types of innovation, including [[social innovation]], can be classed as hidden innovation.


Although originally coined in the 90s by Diana Hicks and Sylvan Katz in their research on the hidden research system involving hospital researchers, and Mike Hopkins research on [[genetic testing]] within the UK healthcare system, the concept of hidden innovation has most recently been promoted by [[NESTA]], in their "Innovation Gap" Report, published October 2006. A later report, called "Hidden innovation", further expands on the concept and identifies four types of hidden innovation:
